#Text=PROMPT : During the story , the reader gets background information about Mr. Leonard . Explain the effect that background information has on Paul . column1: #Text=PROMPT : During the story , the reader gets background information about Mr. Leonard . Explain the effect that background information has on Paul . Support your response with details from the story . 20416 : When Paul sees that Mr. Leonard was a great high school athelete , he is inspired to do his best , and be like him . Also , having someone to look up to that used to do the same thing that you are doing is very nice when trying to accomplish something . When Paul learns that his role model was not a good student , and can not read very well , he is empathetic for his new friend . Now that he and Paul have these things in common , they will begin to help each other in the areas in which they struggle with .

He also found that he was not good at reading either so he was concerned and wanted to help .

In the story , Paul stated that he believed he only did the hurdles at first because he was used to obeying Mr. Leonard . However , after learning about Mr. Leonard , Paul begins to see the similarities between them . Both worked hard and excelled atheletically , but had trouble academically . These similarities make Paul empathetic toward Mr. Leonard and wish to help the man .
